question: No. We don't need them. We'll leave them. Once we've got it, we'll be able to reach the plane by dusk.
answer: The Hovitos are near. The poison is still fresh... three days. They're following us, I tell you.

question: If they knew we were here, they would have killed us already. So this is where Forrestal cashed in.
answer: A friend of yours?

question: Competitor. He was good, very good. No one ever had what we have... partners. Assuming that pillar there marks the corner and...
answer: I knew nothing! He was crazy! Please!

question: Let's go.
answer: What's wrong? Are you lost?

question: Forrestal.
answer: We can go no further.

question: Now, Satipo, we don't want to be discouraged by every little thing. Let me see that. Try not to touch the vines.
answer: Seor, I think we are very close. Let us hurry. There is nothing to fear here.

question: That's what scares me.
answer: There's plenty of light, amigo. From that hole!

question: You wait here.
answer: If you insist, seor. No time to argue. Throw me the idol, I throw you the whip. You have no choice! Hurry! Adios, amigo!

question: Get it going! Get it going! GO! I can't stand snakes. I hate them.
answer: Do you think the idol will ever show up?

question: I don't know. Just because Belloq had it doesn't mean he kept it. Getting it away from those Indians would be a neat trick I hope they got him. That's all right, Phil. Thanks a lot. No. I'll see you Thursday. Hey, if you don't like them, I can always return them.
answer: No, they're beautiful. The Museum will buy them as usual. No questions asked.

question: Then what's wrong?
answer: I brought along some people today.

question: What kind of people?
answer: Government.

question: Government?
answer: Don't worry, it's not about your business. They're from the Army.

question: I've already served.
answer: Army Intelligence. They're looking for Abner.

question: Tanis. Ain't that somethin'!
answer: Frankly, we're a little suspicious... An American being mentioned so prominently in a secret Nazi cable.

question: Ah, Ravenwood's no Nazi.
answer: Then what do they want him for?

question: Which is probably what the Nazis are after.
answer: What's this Ark look like?

question: Look like? Why, it's right here...
answer: Good God!

question: Most certainly.
answer: I've got to talk to you.

question: This isn't really a good time.
answer: Indy, it's important.

question: All right. Come on in. I'll be in a minute.
answer: They want you to go for it. And they'll pay.

question: Good work, Marcus. I had a feeling this would happen. And, of course, the Museum gets the Ark when we're done.
answer: Of course.

question: Okay, here's the way it's gonna be. First, I'll high-tail it to Shanghai and get the piece from General Hok. Then I think I know where I can find Ravenwood. If only I can get -
answer: General Hok's a tough customer. They don't call him the Wild Boar for nothing. And he's tied in with the Japanese.

question: Great. Got it. I've got to get to Nepal.
answer: That does it! I've been patient with you no-goods long enough. I'm not open at 2 o'clock for myself, you know. It's all for you. And how do you repay me Hey you, deaf one! I said out of my place. I don't mean next Easter, I mean now -

question: Hello, Marion. Nice to see you, too.
answer: Get up and get out.

question: Take it easy. I'm looking for your father.
answer: Well you're two years too late. Go home, Mahdlo. I'll see you tomorrow.

question: What happened?
answer: Avalanche. Up there. He was digging. What else? He spent his whole life digging. Dragging me all over this rotten earth. For what?

question: Do you find him?
answer: Hell no. He's buried where he was working. Probably preserved real good, too. In the snow.

question: Not a bad way to go. Doing what he loved.
answer: Don't give me that stuff! What do you know? I'm the one that was left in a bad way. He didn't have a penny. Guess how I lived, Mister Jones. I worked here. And I wasn't the bartender. Finally the guy that owned the joint went crazy. Snow crazy. They took his away screaming. As they dragged him out, he said the place was all mine for life. Can you imagine a more evil curse? So far, it's working.

question: Why not leave? Go back to the States.
answer: I'll go back. I'll get there. Not that there's a soul there who knows my name or cares. But I'll go. And when I do, they'll know me. 'Cause I'm going to go back in style. With money. A goddamn lady!

question: Where you gonna get it?
answer: If I knew that, you think I'd still be running this dive? I'll tell you something Indy. I've learned to hate you in the last ten years. But somehow, no matter how much I hated you, I always knew that someday you'd come through that door. I never doubted that. Something made is inevitable. Why are you here... now... tonight?

question: I need one of the pieces your father collected.
answer: You son-of-a-bitch! You know what you did to me, to my life? This is your handiwork.

question: I never meant to hurt you.
answer: I was a child!

question: You knew what you were doing.
answer: I was in love.

question: I guess that depends on your definition.
answer: It was wrong. You knew it.

question: Look, I did what I did. I don't expect you to be happy about it. But maybe we can do each other some good.
answer: Why start now?

question: Shut up and listen for a second. I want that piece your father had. I've got money.
answer: How much?

question: Enough to get you back to the States. Where are his things?
answer: Gone. I sold it all. It was all junk. The junk he wasted his life on.

question: Everything? That's too bad.
answer: You look disappointed. I like that. How's it feel? What are you drinking?

question: Seltzer.
answer: Real man's drink. Me, I like scotch. And I like bourbon. And vodka and gin. I'm not much for brandy. I'm off that.

question: You're a tough broad now, aren't you?
answer: It's no act, pal. This ain't Schenectady.

question: I can only say I'm sorry so many times.
answer: You really have money? You don't look rich. I may be able to locate some of his things. I know who's got them. What do you want?

question: A bronze piece, about this size. In the shape of the sun. Probably broken off at the bottom. Has a little hole in it, off-center. Does that sound familiar? Do you know where it is?
answer: Maybe. How much?

question: Three thousand. American.
answer: That'll get me back, but not in style. This doodad must be pretty important.

question: Maybe.
answer: I knew it would happen eventually. I knew it. Something had to go my way. I've got to think this out. I'm used to bargaining with yaks.

question: Okay, five thousand. That's all I can give you now. I can get you more when you land in the States.
answer: You word, huh? Just like you said you'd be back last time? That was your word too.

question: I'm back, aren't I? You can trust me.
answer: Come back tomorrow.

question: Why?
answer: Because I said so, that's why. It's about time I called the shots in this relationship. Wait a minute. Leave the five thousand here. You want trust, give some. I want to smell your money.

question: I trust you.
answer: You're an idiot.

question: I've heard that.
answer: Hold it. Come here.

question: Bossy, aren't you?
answer: That's right. Give me a kiss. Get out of my place.

question: Good evening, Fraulein.
answer: The bar's closed.

question: We are not thirsty.
answer: What do you want?

question: The same thing your friend Dr. Jones wanted. Surely he told you there would be other interested parties. Ah, the man is nefarious. I hope for your sake he has not yet acquired it.
answer: Why, are you willing to offer more?

question: Almost certainly. Do you still have it?
answer: No. But I know where it is. How 'bout a drink for you and your men?

question: We will stick to the business at hand, Fraulein.
answer: Fine. Why don't you come back tomorrow when Jones is here and we'll have an auction?

question: I'm afraid an auction is not possible. Your fire is dying here, Fraulein. Why don't you tell us where the piece is right now?
answer: Listen, Herr Mac, I don't know who you're used to dealing with, but no one tells me what to do in my place.

question: Americans! You're all alike. Fraulein Ravenwood. I'll show you want I'm used to.
answer: Wait! I can be reasonable -

question: That time is passed.
answer: You don't need that. I'll tell you everything!

question: Unbelievable!
answer: Let's get out of here!

question: Not without that piece you want!
answer: It's here? Forget it! I want you out of here. Now!

question: There!
answer: Let's go!

question: You burned down my place!
answer: I owe you plenty!

question: You owe me plenty!
answer: You're something!

question: All of Allah's creatures are welcome here. You please us by letting us please you.
answer: I knew the Germans would hire you, Sallah. They couldn't have an excavation in the desert without the best digger in Egypt.

question: All Arabs look alike to them, Indy.
answer: Tell me about the map room at Tanis.

question: We found it three days ago. I broke through myself.
answer: Those Nazis are moving awfully fast.

question: The Frenchman is helping them.
answer: Belloq. So he got away from the Indians. This is going to be more interesting that I thought.

question: I'm afraid this has put the Germans close to finding the Well of the Souls.
answer: Even Belloq won't be able to find it without that. Can you make anything of those markings? They're nothing I'm familiar with.

question: But I know someone who might. You can go to see him tomorrow. Indy... something bothers me.
answer: What is it, my friend?

question: It is the Ark. If it is there, at Tanis... It is not something man was meant to disturb... Death has always surrounded it. It is not of this earth.
answer: Do you really need that monkey?

question: Do you really need that monkey?
answer: I'm surprised at you, Indy. Talking that way about our baby. He's got your looks, too.

question: And your brains.
answer: Hey! Hey!... where're you going?

question: He'll be OK. Come on. Come on. Run! Get out of here! Go, dammit! Go!
answer: Indy-y-y-y!

question: Marion. Too bad. I'm drinking alone. Belloq.
answer: Good evening, Dr. Jones.

question: I ought to kill you right now.
answer: It was not I who brought the girl into this dirty business. Sit down, please, before you fall down. We can behave as civilized people. I'm afraid it will be your last opportunity.

question: Not a very private place for a murder.
answer: These Arabs will not interfere in the white man's business. They do not care if we kill each other off. Terribly difficult finding a decent vintage here. You were quite vigorous in Shanghai. Unfortunately, our friend the Wild Boar had taken the precaution of making several copies of the piece. How odd that is should end this way for us, after so many... stimulating encounters. I almost regret it. Where shall I find a new adversary so close to my own level?

question: Try the local sewer.
answer: I know you despise me. We always hate in others that which we most fear in ourselves. And you and I are very much alike.

question: Now you're getting nasty.
answer: We have always done the same kind of work. Our methods have not differed as much as you pretend. I am a shadowy reflection of you. But it would have taken only a nudge to make you the same as me, to push you out of the light. You know it to be true! How nice. And how ironic the timing. Do you realize what the Ark is? It's a transmitter. A radio for talking to God! And now it is within my grasp.

question: What about your boss, der Fuhrer? I thought he was waiting to take possession.
answer: When the time is right. When I am finished with it.

question: I hope your friends are patient. Dangerous work, Belloq.
answer: Yes. Very. You may consider yourself fortunate that your involvement concludes here.

question: Tell me, did you get away with the idol?
answer: I was lucky to get away with my life. The Hovitos proved quite narrow-minded about the whole matter.

question: You know, if it's God you want to talk to, maybe I can arrange it.
answer: You have not changed. But, please, do not reach for your weapon until you are ready to die.

question: Yes. Yes, I'll come now.
answer: Next time, Indiana Jones, it will take more than children to save you.

question: I thought we would find you there. Better than the United States Marines, eh?
answer: Thanks you. Marion's dead.

question: Yes, I know. I am sorry. More reason than ever to beat the bastards. Life goes on, Indy. There is the proof. I have much to tell you, Indy.
answer: And they made the calculation in the map room?

question: This morning. Belloq and the boss German, Shliemann. When they came out of the map room, we were given a new spot in which to dig... out away from the camp.
answer: The Well of the Souls.

question: We haven't got much time. Where are the Germans digging for the Well of the Souls? Okay. Let's go.
answer: Bring us some of that! Now, idiot! Water. Bring us water.

question: Sallah. Sallah! Sallah!
answer: Hey, you! More water over here! Why aren't you at the digs? Come here! No, dummkopf, I said come!

question: I though you were dead.
answer: They were throwing me around like a rag doll.

question: They must have switched baskets. Thank god for that! Bless those bastards. Have they hurt you?
answer: No. Not since I got here. They just asked about you - what you knew. The Frenchman's got the hot's for me. I've been playing that along. Oh, Indy, get me out of here. What's wrong?

question: I have to leave you here for a little while. I know where the Ark is. If I take you out of here they'll start combing the place for us.
answer: Cut me loose!

question: Keep your voice down.
answer: I said get me out of -

question: I cautioned you about being premature with that communiqu to Berlin. Archeology is not an exact science. If does not adhere to time schedules.
answer: The Fuhrer is not a patient man. He demands constant reports and he expects progress. You led me to believe -

question: Nothing. I have made no promises. I said only that it looked very favorable. Perhaps the Ark will still be found in an adjoining chamber. Based on the information in our possession, my calculations were correct. Perhaps some bit of evidence still eludes us. Perhaps
answer: My feeling exactly. She was in possession of the original piece for years. She may know much. If properly motivated...

question: I tell you, she knows nothing useful.
answer: I'm surprised to find you squeamish. That is not your reputation. But it needn't concern you. I have the perfect man for this kind of work.

question: Don't panic. There's plenty of time for that later. Wave that at anything that slithers.
answer: What are you doing?

question: Just watch the floor.
answer: Whatever you're doing, do it faster.

question: There! Come on! Stay here!
answer: Where are you going?

question: I'll be back in a minute. We're going through this wall. Just keep your eyes open and get ready to run. No matter what happens to me.
answer: What do you mean? Where are you?! Indy! Where are you?! Please Lord!

question: Come on!
answer: The snakes... are they here?

question: I guess not. I think I'd be dead.
answer: Do you know where you're going?

question: Absolutely.
answer: Thank god. Where?

question: Where is it? You two get back to Cairo quick and get us transportation to England - a plane, a ship, anything.
answer: What about you?

question: I'm going to get that truck. I'll meet you at Omar's. Be ready for me.
answer: How are you going to get that truck?

question: I have a feeling I'm not the first woman to travel with these pirates. There's a whole wardrobe in there.
answer: It's lovely.

question: I feel like a virgin bride in this.
answer: That's what you look like.

question: There are some things you can recapture in this life, but that isn't one of them.
answer: What would you like to recapture?

question: Nothing. That is the way it is.
answer: Did I ever say I was sorry I burned down your tavern?

question: No. Then again, I burned up that plane.
answer: You saved my life.

question: And you saved mine.
answer: Seems things have worked out kind of even.

question: That's the way I like them.
answer: Maybe we should consider all past accounts closed.

question: No. Not yet.
answer: What else?

question: What is it?
answer: The engines have shut down.

question: Why?
answer: I'm going to find out. What's wrong? Holy shit.

question: Take it aboard the Wurrfler!
answer: And be very careful!

question: What about Jones? Savage. You are not in a position to ask for anything. We will take what we wish and then decide whether or not to blow your ship from the water.
answer: That girl goes with me. It will be part of my compensation. I'm sure the Fuhrer would approve. If she fails to please me, you can do with her as you wish.

question: What about you? Talked to God yet? Where's the girl?
answer: Doctor Jones, surely you don't think you can escape from this base.

question: That depends on how reasonable we're all willing to be. All I want is the girl. We'll keep possession of the Ark only till we've got safe transport to England. Then it's all yours.
answer: If we refuse?

question: Then the Ark and some of us are going up in a big bang. I don't think Hitler would like that a bit. Now I don't want to talk about this anymore. Show me that girl in five seconds or -
answer: Jones, this is the second time I have seen you looking very foolish.

question: It's a bad habit. I'm trying to break it.
answer: I'll help you. This time I'll kill you myself.

question: Marion! Marion, can you hear me? Hi.
answer: Oh, Indy! Thank god you're here.

question: Glad I could make it. Let's get out of here.
answer: What about the Ark?

question: Are you game?
answer: Hell yes! We've made it this far.

question: I thought we answered that. It's someplace very safe -
answer: That's a powerful force. Research should be done -

question: Oh, it will be, Dr. Jones, I assure you. We have top men working on it right now.
answer: Who?

question: Top men.
answer: We may be able to help.
